reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Kennicott Lodge lacked a lot of basics. I was not expecting to share a bath for $189.00 per night. The room did have a sink that was not functioning. The food was ok, but certainly not memorable. I was not thrilled to be served "family style" (only a few tables were everyone sat together). For $30 per person I was expecting more than platters of roadhouse food. On the bright side, the people were very nice and had lots of good information on the area. After Dinner there was a slide show on flightseeing, note: go flight seeing rather than watching a slide show on it! The buildings in Kennicott are worth the trip.
reviews.title: Not the comfort and quality advertised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a short scenic flight from Chitina with the Wrangell Air we were picked up by the shuttle from the lodge and driven 3 miles on a bumpy road full of potholes and a few chickens.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room in the new south wing was large, properly decorated, with windows facing the glacier and mountains, nice very clean bathroom with plenty of towels. There was no hair dryer and I didn't care about it but it may be a big issue to those who have to have a hair dryer regardless where they stay.
reviews.title: A fun, historical place, if not a little hard to get to

reviews.text: Breakfast is served buffet style from 7 o'clock until, I think, 9 AM. We never waited until 9 am anyway as we like to start our day early. There is a choice of a continental breakfast for $9.95 or a hot buffet breakfast for $15.95. Dinners were surprisingly very creative with plenty of vegetables and served a family style and that meant everyone is eating at 7 PM. Staff was great.
reviews.title: history,view, tasty food, great walks

likes.liked: — fabulous views of the glacier, tasty food, friendly staff

reviews.title: Kennicott Glacier Lodge - Warm, friendly, spectacular view
reviews.text: There are two guiding companies located in Kennecott and they take visitors on many various outdoor activities. We are independent travelers and opted to focus on our own activities this time. We started out our hike before 8 am which meant nobody was on a trail but us and black bears. We hiked to the glacier, then continue on the trail to Erie Mine. By the time we got to the glacier, clouds disappeared and for the rest of the day we had a gorgeous clear day with a blue sky and incredible views of the mountains.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kennicott (the place itself) isn't for everybody. For one thing, it's difficult to get to . The choices are a bumpy 60 mile gravel road or a small plane ride between huge mountains.
reviews.title: Go before the cruise ship crowd discovers it

likes.disliked: — not much to do at night

reviews.title: Outstanding Lodge
reviews.text: But, after being herded around Denali , Prince William Sound and Talkeetna with the Princess Lodge crowd, it was wonderful. It's full of people from all over the world, most of them independent travelers in their 40's and 50's, many of them European. They come here to hike, which is good, because there isn't much else to do. The family-style seating at dinner seemed forced and overly folksy at first, but soon everybody is laughing and telling stories, the people are interesting, and it's nice to feel like you know your "neighbors" when you run into them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was much better than I expected it to be; one night we had Copper River salmon (the Copper River runs through Chitna.) Wine and beer are not included in the meal plan, though, and are expensive.
reviews.title: Great place..loved it...not for everyone

likes.liked: — Comfort of the room, the view, the meals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room in the South Wing, which was clean and delightfully comfortable, with surprising water pressure and plenty of hot water (rare in back country Alaska, or so I've heard). Since this lodge is pretty much the only space in Kennicott besides the old mine -- the closest bar and restaurant are four miles away in McCarthy -- the setting wouldn't be of much interest to anyone who isn't comfortable hiking in the mountains (and the "easy to moderate" Root Glacier trail is mis-classified, IMHO -- parts of it would be a real challenge to older people)!
reviews.title: Worh it for the location and overall experience

likes.disliked: — noisy rooms, but adds to the experience as makes you relive the mining days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your requirements include a phone, TV, radio, cell service or internet, this isn't the place for you. There aren't even any clocks in the rooms. The idea is to Get Away.
reviews.title: Spectacular views, Historic setting

likes.liked: — Incredible location, great food and service, historic location

reviews.title: A great lodge at a great place
reviews.text: We stayed only one day in the Kennicott Lodge. It was one of our highlights within our Alska trip.

reviews.title: Definitely a must stay!
reviews.text: We stayed in the southwing of the lodge in a room with privat bath. The rooms were just perfect. Clean with comfort and a great view on the glacier. The dinner was family style. Perfect food with friendly service. So was the breakfast- you have to try the fresh bakery! All in all the team made us feel really at home and surrounded our Wrangell NP experinence with excellent service. (The only point to mention is the picture from the lodge in the internet: it didn´t show at all how nice this place is-you can expect more).

reviews.title: A Unique Treat
reviews.text: This is must if you travel to the Wrangell NP.

The Kennicott Glacier Lodge is located the the abondoned copper mining town of Kennicott Alaska. To get there, you have to drive 60 miles on a gravel road that has been layed out over the old railroad tracks that used to service the town. The roads ends at the Kennicott river and you have to cross a foot bridge to catch a van for the five mile ride to the lodge.
reviews.title: One of my favorite places, ever
